description:
A leading political journalist has said that banning the AfD is "overdue" and insists political repression is perfectly fine when exercised by a "constitutional state". Can these people hear themselves, wonders Eugyppius.

The post Leading Political Journalist Says Banning the AfD is “Overdue” and Insists Political Repression is Perfectly Fine When Exercised by a “Constitutional State” appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Leading Political Journalist Says Banning the AfD is “Overdue” and Insists Political Repression is Perfectly Fine When Exercised by a “Constitutional State”

description:
The rise of the digital world has led to a new form of economic order, technofeudalism, in which "cloud capitalists" like Amazon and Google dominate and take their cut, says Yanis Varoufakis. Prof James Alexander agrees.

The post We Live in Google’s World Now appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: We Live in Google’s World Now

description:
The local government of Port Hedland in Australia has voted to call for the immediate suspension of Covid vaccines pending an investigation into evidence of excessive levels of synthetic DNA in the shots.

The post Australian Local Government Calls for Suspension of Covid mRNA Vaccines appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Australian Local Government Calls for Suspension of Covid mRNA Vaccines

description:
The true typical range of the latest electric vehicles is up to 50% lower than advertised figures, new research has revealed, leading to question about whether consumers really know what they're buying.

The post True Range of EVs Up to 50% Lower than Advertised appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: True Range of EVs Up to 50% Lower than Advertised

description:
The clamour for slavery reparations isn't going away. But is it just an excuse for Caribbean countries to demand piles of U.K. taxpayer money? Olga Gillies attended the recent debate in the House of Lords and reports back.

The post Are ‘Slavery Reparations’ Just an Excuse for Caribbean Countries to Demand Huge Piles of U.K. Taxpayer Money? appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Are ‘Slavery Reparations’ Just an Excuse for Caribbean Countries to Demand Huge Piles of U.K. Taxpayer Money?

description:
Doctors will be trained to consider the "climate impact" of asthma inhalers under a new European-wide curriculum being developed that will "infuse" environmental considerations throughout the timetable.

The post Doctors “Will be Expected to Consider Climate Impact of Inhalers” appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Doctors “Will be Expected to Consider Climate Impact of Inhalers”

description:
Meet Mukund Krishna, the "self-serving" Police Federation CEO who suspended Chair Rick Prior after he defended the rank-and-file. He's a management consultant with no experience of policing, and it shows.

The post Meet Mukund Krishna, the “Self-Serving” Police Federation CEO who Suspended Chair Rick Prior After He Defended the Rank-and-File appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Meet Mukund Krishna, the “Self-Serving” Police Federation CEO who Suspended Chair Rick Prior After He Defended the Rank-and-File

description:
A summary of the most interesting stories in the past 24 hours that challenge the prevailing orthodoxy about the ‘climate emergency’, public health ‘crises’ and the supposed moral defects of Western civilisation.

The post News Round-Up appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: News Round-Up
